choices.A: The user must log in again to authenticate.
choices.B: The user will be denied access to resources without authentication.
choices.D: User authentication happens at an interface level.
choices.C: The user will not be prompted for authentication.

discussion.content:
If there is a fall-through policy in place, unauthenticated users will no be prompted for authentication.
C is correct
A should be the correct answer

I donÂ´t know what this means 
Implicitly (default) - Implicitly trigger firewall authentication on demand.
C is correct according to the Infrastructure_Manual, p. 343
C and the page is Infrastructure - 363.

questions.question_text: When using WPAD DNS method, which FQDN format do browsers use to query the DNS server?
Which statement about a One-to-One IP pool is true?

choices.D: It does not use port address translation.
choices.A: It is used for destination NAT.
choices.B: It limits the client to 64 connections per IP pool.
choices.C: It allows the fixed mapping of an internal address range to an external address range.

discussion.content: D is correct - FGT_Security-6.2, p.155 ( A is not correct - DNAT requires fixed IP address mapping)

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The exhibit shows the IPS sensor configuration.
If traffic matches this IPS sensor, which two actions is the sensor expected to take? (Choose two.)

choices.D: The sensor will gather a packet log for all matched traffic.
choices.A: The sensor will allow attackers matching the NTP.Spoofed.KoD.DoS signature.
choices.C: The sensor will reset all connections that match these signatures.
choices.B: The sensor will block all attacks aimed at Windows servers.

questions.question_text:
An administrator wants to throttle the total volume of SMTP sessions to their email server.
Which DoS sensor can the administrator use to achieve this?
